item.title: AI Product Development (Part I)
item.description: Build a product, not a model.

item.title: How To Create This Blog
item.description: Getting Started with Hugo Hugo is a static site generator (SSG). Simply put, an SSG prepares everything needed to display a website. In contrast, dynamically assembled websites obtain their assets only after they get accessed. An SSG thus minimizes the computational demand on the server, which allows providers, such as GitHub Pages and others1, to host your static sites for free. More importantly, SSGs emanate a philosophy of simplicity-by-design stemming from a number of limitations.

item.title: Data Science Anti-Patterns: Proliferating Data Artifacts

item.description: Data science projects are people projects.
